page.title: 03GOVERNMENT SERVICES IN BURY
page.content:
Government Services In Bury.
The Parish Council is a committee of seven councillors democratically elected to represent the local people. The council inform the District Council of any faults in the roads and anything else that needs attending to. The Parish Council gets its funds from the District Council,the funds are then spent on the roadworks and things of this nature.Every two months the council meet at Bury school. One member of the Parish Council,Mr. Bodle,who also runs Bury Post Office thought that his job had not helped him to gain his position on the council but the council had helped him in his job.He thought this because he worked locally.The council is beneficial in the life of the area.
